Lab results show normal sodium, potassium, and glucose levels, but elevated white blood cell count. Other lab values are within normal range.

Assessment and plan include hypotension, respiratory failure due to underlying COPD, and the possibility of an acute infection. The patient will continue on steroids, and antibiotics will be continued for bronchitis associated with COPD. A high WBC count is noted, and Clostridium difficile should be checked since the patient has been on antibiotics for two months.
